Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR

Source: R/ggvar_irf.R
ggvar_irf.Rd

Plots the result of a irf call.

Usage

ggvar_irf(
  x,
  n.ahead = NULL,
  series_impulse = NULL,
  series_response = NULL,
  facet = "ggplot",
  ci = 0.95,
  ...,
  palette = c("black", "blue", "gray"),
  scales = "fixed",
  independent = "y"
)

Arguments

x

A "varest" objecto to pass to irf, or, directly, a "varirf" object.

n.ahead

An interger. The size of the forecast horizon, passed to irf. Unused if `x` is "varirf".

series_impulse

A character vector with variables to consider for the impulses. Defaults to all (NULL).

series_response

A character vector with variables to consider for the responses. Defaults to all (NULL).

facet

The facet "engine" to be used. "ggplot2" for facet_grid, "ggh4x" for facet_grid2.

ci

The level of confidence for the irf. Set to FALSE to omit.

...

Further arguments passed to irf.

palette

A vector of colors (bins, normal curve). See vignette("palettes").

scales

"fixed" (the default), "free", "free_x" or "free_y". passed to facet_wrap.

independent

For varying the scales of each cell. See facet_grid2.

Value

An object of class ggplot.

Examples

ggvar_irf(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets), n.ahead = 10)
